transcript.text: Hello ladies and gentlemen,

We are at a few hours
before the first round

of the 2017 presidential elections,
a few hours before a choice
that will be your choice.

A choice for the future of your country,
for your own future.

And I speak to you this evening
when, just a few hours ago,

a new terrorist attack struck Paris
again,

killed a policeman, wounded several of 
them,
and other persons as well.
And of course I want to reiterate my solidarity with the family and colleagues

of the victim,
and all the families
of those who have been injured.

To reiterate how much  I know
and measure the gravity of the moment
and what lies ahead.
The necessity at every moment to live up of this prime mission
which is that of the President of the Republic: to protect.
Protect all French people.

But beyond what has happened to us,
beyond what has happened in many European capitals
in recent months, what is struck,

is democracy.
Now is a moment of choice.
The moment of our choice.

And I want to tell you with equal solemnity
and gravity:
do not be afraid.

Do not yield  to fear,
yield nothing to division,

yield nothing to the overbidding:
this is what our assailants are waiting for,

that's what they want, it is their
bet.
Let us do their wrong.

Let us choose to be what we are:
a free, strong, standing upright people
who walks.

This is why the choice you  will
make this Sunday
is also the choice of your future.
And I want to tell you here: what I am carrying out, the project we have designed,
is the one that allows France to build the future with efficiency and justice,
which can be its own for this 21st century.

Faced with these risks,
these transformations in the world, we can succeed.

So I want to address the last undecided
:
to you, undecided from the left wing, to you coming from the left wing,
or feeling you owe it your vote in some ways, I want to tell you:
the project I am carrying out is an equal opportunities project,
a project of true equality, and of correction of social injustice.

Not by penalizing, or by preventing some
from succeeding
but by relying on school, culture, work,

economic and social transformation
and mobility.

A project that will further allow
each and every one, no matter their family of origin,
whatever their skin color,
whatever their religion, whatever their sex,
to find their place in society.
To have more opportunities than you have today.
To you who are hesitant, and  come from the right wing,
you are about to vote for the candidate of this party

or of the same affinity: I strongly beleive
that the project
I am defending is the one that best supports freedom of enterprise, the  liberation
of the economy as well as of society, and true innovation.
Both the values of entrepreneurship and the actual measures that will be taken will enable

all those who want to create,
undertake and succeed,

to do it even more easily
and quickly in our country.
And you still undecided and coming from the center, you who are attached to Europe, and social democracy:
look at the reality of the project I carry,

it is the only true European project
 of this election

it is the only real project that will restore
its place to unions

in social dialogue, in the company,
and in the industry.

Our project is comprehensive, it is ambitious,
it carries out profound reforms,
real, ambitious, and unprecedented transformations in our country,
and it protects individuals, not formally,
but by allowing them to succeed or bounce back.

It protects the weakest because our
country
will not be able to succeed and rise again, if its story
is limited to the success of a few.
So ask yourself the question, forget the fear, forget  promises that are not tenable,

do not give in to nostalgia, to withdrawal,
and ask yourself what is the project
that will allow to build a reasonable and ambitious future, that is to say,
a possible future, a true future.

I tell you this with deep conviction:
the responsibility of our generation,
is to build this future for France.
So on Sunday, vote, it is the most important, regardless who you choose.

Go and vote, move on, because
it is the most beautiful act of resistance

against our assailants, facing the doubt
facing what corrupts us.

And Sunday, if you believe in the future
of France,

vote for the project I defend,
come vote for me.
Thank you.
